div.l: A Ioly poppar bare he in his pouche
There was no man̄ for ꝑperell durst hym̄ touche
A Sheffelde thwytell bare he in his hose
Rounde was his face and camused was his nose
As pilled as an̄ ape was his sculle
He was a MarketMaketMarket beter at the fulle
There durst no wight hande on̄ hym̄ legge
That he ne swore anon̄ he shulde abegge
A Thef he was forsoth of corn̄ and mele
And that a sly and vsaunt for to stele
His name was hote digneus Symkyn̄
A wyf he hadde comyn̄ of noble kyn̄
The parson̄ of the Toune hire fader was
With hure he yaf full many a pan̄ of bras
For that Symkyn̄ shulde yn his blode a lye
She was fostred in a Nonnerye
For Symkyn̄ wolde no wif ~meidewif as he seide
But she were · well norisshed or a Meide
To save his estate of yomanrye
And she was proude and perte as a pye
A full faire sight was it vppon̄ hem̄ two
On̄ holy days a forn̄ hure wolde he go
With his Tippet wounden̄ aboute his hede
And she cam aftur yn Gite of Rede
And Symkyn̄ had hosen̄ of the same
There durst nowight clepe hure but dame
Was none so hardy that wente by the way
That with hure durst rage other play
But yif he wolde be slayne of Symkyn̄
With panade knyf or with Boidekyn̄
For Ielous folke ben̄ ꝑperilous eủere mo
Algate they wolde hure wyfes wende so
And eke for she was somdele smotirliche
She was as deyne as water in a Diche
So full of hoker and of bysmare
Hure thought that a lady shulde hure spare
What for hure kynred and hure nortelrie
That she had lerned in the Nonnerie
A doughtur had they betwixt hem̄ two
Of xxᵗⁱ · yere olde · withoute eny mo ennabling collatio
